item.title: Keyple Common API
item.description:
Overview
Description The Keyple Common API provides public interfaces shared by all Keyple libraries.
Intended Audience All developers.
Compatible OS Windows, Linux, macOS, Android.
Versioning Note The third version digit x.y.Z refers only to documentation updates, as this component contains no implementation.

Implementations

  • Java
  • C++
Latest Version 2.0.2
Changelog List of changes and new features introduced in each release.
GitHub Source code repository and issue tracker for the Java project.
User Guide Step-by-step guide to learn how to build a Keyple-based standalone application.
API Reference Complete documentation of all classes and methods in the Java API.
UML Class Diagram UML diagram showing the structure and relationships between classes.
Maven Central Official Maven Central page to include the Java component in your project.
Latest Version 2.0.1
Release History List of published releases and related release notes.
GitHub Source code repository and documentation for the C++ project.
User Guide Step-by-step guide to learn how to build a Keyple-based standalone application.
API Reference Complete documentation of all classes and functions in the C++ API.
UML Class Diagram UML class diagram of the Java implementation, from which the C++ code is derived.

C++ Specific Information

Versioning

The Keyple C++ implementation is a transposition of the Java version. As a result, the C++ version may lag behind the Java version by one or more release cycles.

To make version correspondence explicit:

  • The Java implementation follows Semantic Versioning (SemVer) with three digits:
    MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH
  • The C++ implementation uses four digits:
    MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH.CPP_FIX

In this scheme, the first three digits of the C++ version reflect the corresponding Java source version, while the fourth digit represents any C++-specific fixes or adjustments.

UML Class Diagrams

The class structure of the C++ implementation is directly inspired by the UML class diagrams of the Java version, ensuring conceptual and architectural consistency between both languages.

User Guides

The user guides mainly provide Java code snippets, but the same concepts and logic are directly transposable to the C++ implementation.

item.title: Keyple Distributed Local API
item.description:
Overview
Description The Keyple Distributed Local API defines the internal interfaces used to build the local service components that are part of the Keyple Distributed solution.
Intended Audience Developers creating or extending local Keyple distributed services.
Compatible OS Windows, Linux, macOS, Android.
Versioning Note The third version digit x.y.Z refers only to documentation updates, as this component contains no implementation.

Implementations

  • Java
Latest Version 2.2.1
Changelog List of changes and new features introduced in each release.
GitHub Source code repository and issue tracker for the Java project.
API Reference Complete documentation of all classes and methods in the Java API.
UML Class Diagram UML diagram showing the structure and relationships between classes.
Maven Central Official Maven Central page to include the Java component in your project.

item.title: Keyple Distributed Remote API
item.description:
Overview
Description The Keyple Distributed Remote API defines the internal interfaces used to build the remote plugin components that are part of the Keyple Distributed solution.
Intended Audience Developers creating or extending remote Keyple distributed plugins.
Compatible OS Windows, Linux, macOS, Android.
Versioning Note The third version digit x.y.Z refers only to documentation updates, as this component contains no implementation.

Implementations

Latest Version 3.1.1
Changelog List of changes and new features introduced in each release.

API Reference Complete documentation of all classes and methods in the Java API.
UML Class Diagram UML diagram showing the structure and relationships between classes.
Maven Central Official Maven Central page to include the Java component in your project.

item.title: Keyple Plugin API
item.description:
Overview
Description The Keyple Plugin API defines the internal interfaces dedicated to the development of reader plugin add-ons.
Intended Audience Developers creating custom Keyple reader plugin add-ons.
Compatible OS Windows, Linux, macOS, Android.
Versioning Note The third version digit x.y.Z refers only to documentation updates, as this component contains no implementation.

Implementations

  • Java
  • C++
Latest Version 2.3.2
Changelog List of changes and new features introduced in each release.
GitHub Source code repository and issue tracker for the Java project.
User Guide Step-by-step guide to learn how to create a Keyple reader plugin add-on.
API Reference Complete documentation of all classes and methods in the Java API.
UML Class Diagram UML diagram showing the structure and relationships between classes.
Maven Central Official Maven Central page to include the Java component in your project.

  • The Java implementation follows Semantic Versioning (SemVer) with three digits:

  • The C++ implementation uses four digits:
    MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH.CPP_FIX

In this scheme, the first three digits of the C++ version reflect the corresponding Java source version, while the fourth digit represents any C++-specific fixes or adjustments.

The class structure of the C++ implementation is directly inspired by the UML class diagrams of the Java version, ensuring conceptual and architectural consistency between both languages.

item.title: Keyple Plugin Storage Card API
item.description:
Overview
Description The Keyple Plugin Storage Card API defines the internal interfaces dedicated to standardize communication between Keyple plugins and APDU interpreters for storage card processing.
Intended Audience Developers creating custom reader plugin add-ons and storage card APDU interpreters.
Compatible OS Windows, Linux, macOS, Android.
Versioning Note The third version digit x.y.Z refers only to documentation updates, as this component contains no implementation.

Implementations

  • Java
Latest Version 1.0.0
Changelog List of changes and new features introduced in each release.
GitHub Source code repository and issue tracker for the Java project.
User Guide Step-by-step guide to learn how to create a Keyple reader plugin add-on.
API Reference Complete documentation of all classes and methods in the Java API.
UML Class Diagram UML diagram showing the structure and relationships between classes.
Maven Central Official Maven Central page to include the Java component in your project.

item.title: Keyple Service Library
item.description:
Overview
Description The Keyple Service Library contains the implementation of the core Keyple components and services, such as the smart card service, the card selection manager and the card and reader event manager.
Intended Audience Developers creating Keyple-based applications.
Compatible OS Windows, Linux, macOS, Android.

Implementations

  • Java
  • C++
Latest Version 3.3.5
Changelog List of changes and new features introduced in each release.
GitHub Source code repository and issue tracker for the Java project.
User Guide Step-by-step guide to learn how to build a Keyple-based standalone application.
API Reference Complete documentation of all classes and methods in the Java API.
UML Class Diagram UML diagram showing the structure and relationships between classes.
Maven Central Official Maven Central page to include the Java component in your project.
Latest Version 3.2.3
Release History List of published releases and related release notes.
GitHub Source code repository and documentation for the C++ project.
User Guide Step-by-step guide to learn how to build a Keyple-based standalone application.
API Reference Complete documentation of all classes and functions in the C++ API.
UML Class Diagram UML class diagram of the Java implementation, from which the C++ code is derived.

C++ Specific Information

Versioning

The Keyple C++ implementation is a transposition of the Java version. As a result, the C++ version may lag behind the Java version by one or more release cycles.

To make version correspondence explicit:

  • The Java implementation follows Semantic Versioning (SemVer) with three digits:
    MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH
  • The C++ implementation uses four digits:
    MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH.CPP_FIX

In this scheme, the first three digits of the C++ version reflect the corresponding Java source version, while the fourth digit represents any C++-specific fixes or adjustments.

The class structure of the C++ implementation is directly inspired by the UML class diagrams of the Java version, ensuring conceptual and architectural consistency between both languages.

The user guides mainly provide Java code snippets, but the same concepts and logic are directly transposable to the C++ implementation.

item.title: Keyple Service Resource Library
item.description:
Overview
Description The Keyple Service Resource Library is an add-on providing profile-based card resource allocation mechanism.
Intended Audience Developers creating Keyple-based applications or card extension add-ons.
Compatible OS Windows, Linux, macOS, Android.

Implementations

  • Java
  • C++
Latest Version 3.1.0
Changelog List of changes and new features introduced in each release.
GitHub Source code repository and issue tracker for the Java project.
User Guide Step-by-step guide to learn how to configure and use the Keyple card resource service.
API Reference Complete documentation of all classes and methods in the Java API.
UML Class Diagram UML diagram showing the structure and relationships between classes.
Maven Central Official Maven Central page to include the Java component in your project.
Latest Version 2.0.2
Release History List of published releases and related release notes.
GitHub Source code repository and documentation for the C++ project.
User Guide Step-by-step guide to learn how to configure and use the Keyple card resource service.
API Reference Complete documentation of all classes and functions in the C++ API.
UML Class Diagram UML class diagram of the Java implementation, from which the C++ code is derived.

C++ Specific Information

Versioning

The Keyple C++ implementation is a transposition of the Java version. As a result, the C++ version may lag behind the Java version by one or more release cycles.

To make version correspondence explicit:

  • The Java implementation follows Semantic Versioning (SemVer) with three digits:
